greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) where a(n)=-a(-n), a(1)=a(2)=a(3)=a(4)=1, and a(n+2)*a(n-2) = a(n+1)*a(n-1) - c(n)*a(n)^2 where c(3*k)=-2, else c(n)=1.
comment: Let w := (-2)^(1/3), t(n) = w * a(n) if n = 3*k else t(n) = a(n). Then t(n+2)*t(n-2) = t(n+1)*t(n-1) - w*t(n)^2 for all n in Z.
t(n) is a strong elliptic divisibility sequence t_n as given in [Kimberling, p. 16] where x = 1, y = w, z = 1.
Given elliptic curve 196.a2 E: y^2 = x^3 - x^2 - 2*x + 1 and P = (0,1) the generator, then n*P = ( -w^2*t(n-1)*t(n+1) / t(n)^2, t(2*n) / t(n)^4).
link: C. Kimberling, Strong divisibility sequences and some conjectures, Fib. Quart., 17 (1979), 13-17.
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Oct 20 2018
